{"id":1264512710,"question_id":2915,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"3Â weeks","timestamp":1716348016,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1264512710/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Count of Interesting Subarrays","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\n    public long countInterestingSubarrays(List<Integer> nums, int modulo, int k) {\n\n        long res = 0L;\n\n        int[] arr = new int[nums.size()];\n        int len = arr.length;\n        for(int i=0; i<arr.length; i++){\n            arr[i] = nums.get(i)%modulo==k ? 1 : 0;\n        }\n\n        Map<Long, Integer> map = new HashMap<>(); // sum, cnt\n        map.put(0L, 1);\n\n        long presum = 0 ;\n        for(int i=0; i<len; i++){\n            presum += arr[i];\n            long mod = (presum + modulo)%modulo;\n            if(map.containsKey(mod)){\n                res+= map.get(mod);\n            }\n\n            map.put(mod, map.getOrDefault(mod, 0)+1);\n        }\n\n        return res;\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"count-of-interesting-subarrays","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
